oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of James Atkins Lauderdale, Co. B, 8th Tennessee Infantry Regiment, USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: James Atkins Lauderdale was born near Bright Hope (Greene Co., Tennessee) May 7, 1840. He joined Co. B, 8th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA) He was wounded at Lost Mountain, Georiga May 27, 1864 and was buried at New Hope Church, Georiga and later reuburied at the National Cemetery in Marietta, Georgia. He married Martha Ottinger August 26, 1862. He gave her a pair of earrings when he left for war that survive (newp014). Lauderdale appears in a Federal army frock coat and holds a Colt revolver.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lauderdale, James Atkins
